ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Spermicide

A medical contraceptive device of soft flexible material, usually of thin rubber, that is designed to cover the cervix uteri prior to sexual intercourse to prevent the entry of spermatozoa. To enhance efficacy, a spermicidal agent is often placed within the device. Antimicrobial agent(s) can also be used to prevent sexually transmitted diseases. Efficacy of vaginal diaphragm against infections is very limited.

Concepts.definition: A medical contraceptive device of soft flexible material, usually of thin rubber, that is designed to cover the cervix uteri prior to sexual intercourse to prevent the entry of spermatozoa. To enhance efficacy, a spermicidal agent is often placed within the device. Antimicrobial agent(s) can also be used to prevent sexually transmitted diseases. Efficacy of vaginal diaphragm against infections is very limited.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Rhythm
To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

Concepts.definition: To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A contraceptive device consisting of a thin rubber or latex sheath worn over the penis during intercourse.

Concepts.definition: A contraceptive device consisting of a thin rubber or latex sheath worn over the penis during intercourse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device inserted and left in the uterus to prevent effective conception.

Concepts.definition: A solid intended for placement within the uterine cavity where active and/or inert ingredient(s) are released from an apparatus at a controlled rate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormonal patch
Vaginal ring
Depo provera
Compounds, usually hormonal, taken orally in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy. The hormones are generally estrogen or progesterone or both.

Concepts.definition: An agent taken orally to prevent conception.

PermissibleValues.value: Vasectomy of a Male Partner with a Second FDA Approved Method
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vasectomy With Second Contraception Approved By Food and Drug Administration

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vasectomy With Second Contraception Approved By Food and Drug Administration
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the ductus deferens, or a portion of it. It is done in association with prostatectomy, or to induce infertility. It assures the safety of foods and cosmetics, and the safety and efficacy of pharmaceuticals, biological products, radiation emitting products, medical devices, and also, animal feed and drugs.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the vas deferens.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prevention of contraception by not engaging in sexual intercourse.

Concepts.definition: Prevention of conception by not engaging in sexual intercourse.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot."

Concepts.definition: The prevention of conception or impregnation by the use of devices or drugs or surgery.
Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A drug implant that acts as a birth control device and which is inserted under the skin for drug delivery into the body.

Concepts.definition: A drug implant that acts as a birth control device and which is inserted under the skin for drug delivery into the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The birth control method that utilizes external source of sex hormones to prevent pregnancy by interfering with the ovulation, fertilization or implantation of the fertilized egg in the uterus.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Something that blocks, prevents, separates, or limits.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intrauterine Device Intrauterine Delivery System Dosage Form And Barrier Device

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intrauterine Device Intrauterine Delivery System Dosage Form And Barrier Device
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A device usually made of plastic or metal, inserted into the uterus to prevent conception. IUCD can be a coil, loop, triangle, or T in shape; its material can be impregnated with a pharmaceutical agent. The primary action of all IUCDs is the induction of a foreign-body reaction within the endometrium. This sterile inflammatory process is toxic to gametes, primarily spermatozoa, and effectively prevents viable sperm from passing into the fallopian tubes. The copper-bearing device has an independent toxic effect on spermatozoa. The progestin-releasing devices produce changes in endometrial architecture and function that reduce the potential for implantation of a fertilized egg. The progestin effect on the cervical mucus also reduces the penetrability of sperm.: Solid single-dose delivery system intended for intrauterine use that releases its contents of active substance(s) over an extended period of time.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Something that blocks, prevents, separates, or limits.

Concepts.definition: A device usually made of plastic or metal, inserted into the uterus to prevent conception. IUCD can be a coil, loop, triangle, or T in shape; its material can be impregnated with a pharmaceutical agent. The primary action of all IUCDs is the induction of a foreign-body reaction within the endometrium. This sterile inflammatory process is toxic to gametes, primarily spermatozoa, and effectively prevents viable sperm from passing into the fallopian tubes. The copper-bearing device has an independent toxic effect on spermatozoa. The progestin-releasing devices produce changes in endometrial architecture and function that reduce the potential for implantation of a fertilized egg. The progestin effect on the cervical mucus also reduces the penetrability of sperm.
Solid single-dose delivery system intended for intrauterine use that releases its contents of active substance(s) over an extended period of time.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A structure or object that impedes free movement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body (partial hysterectomy) or the uterine body and cervix (total hysterectomy).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.: A method of female sterilization where the fallopian tubes are surgically ligated to prevent conception.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
A method of female sterilization where the fallopian tubes are surgically ligated to prevent conception.

Concepts.definition: The birth control method that utilizes external source of sex hormones to prevent pregnancy by interfering with the ovulation, fertilization or implantation of the fertilized egg in the uterus.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A device usually made of plastic or metal, inserted into the uterus to prevent conception. IUCD can be a coil, loop, triangle, or T in shape; its material can be impregnated with a pharmaceutical agent. The primary action of all IUCDs is the induction of a foreign-body reaction within the endometrium. This sterile inflammatory process is toxic to gametes, primarily spermatozoa, and effectively prevents viable sperm from passing into the fallopian tubes. The copper-bearing device has an independent toxic effect on spermatozoa. The progestin-releasing devices produce changes in endometrial architecture and function that reduce the potential for implantation of a fertilized egg. The progestin effect on the cervical mucus also reduces the penetrability of sperm.
